title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: U.S. deports dozens of migrants to Ukraine amid war

items.title: Kamala Harris Hits Campaign Trail in Tennessee Special Election
items.description: On Tuesday, the former vice president made her first campaign appearance for another Democrat since leaving office.

items.title: Judge sides with Meta in antitrust trial, will not spin off WhatsApp and Instagram
items.description: A federal judge ruled against the Federal Trade Commission's antitrust suit alleging that Meta had stifled competition by buying up its rivals.

items.title: Federal Court Blocks Texas’ Republican-Friendly Congressional Map
items.description: The move dealt a blow to efforts by Texas Republicans and President Trump to flip Democratic seats in the state. Gov. Greg Abbott said the state would...

items.title: On Republican Neo-Nazism, Hamas and Israel: An Epidemic of Moral Cowardice
items.description: People with extreme ideology don’t care anymore about hiding their excesses or their agendas. It’s all out there online or on YouTube.

items.title: Trump administration shares new moves to dismantle more of the Education Department

items.title: Trump Administration Announces Steps to Dismantle Education Department
items.description: Responsibilities for K-12 and college programs, among others, will be moved to other federal agencies.

items.title: The Three Republican Women Who Defied Trump on Epstein
items.description: Lauren Boebert, Marjorie Taylor Greene and Nancy Mace resisted pressure from the president and made the vote to release the Epstein files possible.

items.title: Farewell, fair penny. You are finished, but never forgotten

items.title: Live Updates: Trump Praises Saudi Prince and Dismisses Question About Killing of Journalist

items.title: U.S. Military Threat Puts Spotlight on Venezuela’s Allies
items.description: American adversaries are unlikely to help President Nicolás Maduro of Venezuela fend off a concerted attack. But they have made toppling him harder.

items.title: Investigating a Recycling Disaster
items.description: We went to Nigeria, where recycling plants are extracting lead for use in American and European car batteries — at a terrible human cost.

items.title: The Auto Industry’s Lead Recycling Program is Poisoning People
items.description: We documented the toxic fallout of a green technology.

items.title: The Saudi crown prince receives an especially warm welcome at the White House.
